content.description: The crux is getting into the bottom of the roof and jamming your way right to gain a right-facing corner stem.  Then you get a classic roof traverse exit.
content.protection: 5 bolts (Cams #0.75-#2) and some long runners to avoid rope drag.
content.location: This is on Left Wire crag in the middle of the crag.  It ascends a slab with 4 bolts to a hanging, right-facing dihedral.

content.description:
This is a variation of

Addicts

that keeps the fun crack climbing up high but skips the bolted face, including the thin height-dependent move getting into the crack. Start in the crack system just left of

Addicts

up to a ledge, then go up the wide crack to the base of the first roof. Traverse under the roof to meet up with

Addicts

.

The route still has some flaking rock, both on the face and the wide crack section, so be careful.
content.protection:
As the name implies, this variation is purer trad than

Addicts

. I would recommend a full rack. I used a #4 c4 for the fist crack, though any large piece should work. Micro cams are useful for the start of the roof.

This route follows the protectable crack system which is very much not a straight line. Bring long slings.

content.description: There are two cruxes for this one.  Pulling over the 1st overhang to a nice technical face to a tricky dismount to the anchors
content.location: This is at the Left Wire crag.
